news.title: Urban Pumping Raises Arsenic Risk in Southeast Asia
news.summary: Return to Article List Next Article > Credit: Courtesy Mason Stahl High concentrations of arsenic are making their way from the Red River into aquifers near Hanoi, Vietnam, a new study shows.

news.title: Urban pumping raises arsenic risk in Southeast Asia
news.summary: Large-scale groundwater pumping is opening doors for dangerously high levels of arsenic to enter some of Southeast Asia's aquifers, with water now seeping in through riverbeds with arsenic concentrations more than 100 times the limits of safety…

news.title: Urban water pumping raises arsenic risk in Southeast Asia
news.summary: Normally, groundwater levels in this monsoon region are higher than the rivers, so water flows from aquifers into adjacent waterways.
